item.description:
Sneaky Cards 2 contains 54 brand new missions for you to complete! Become a secret agent of joy, spreading creativity and kindness to an unsuspecting public. Give a stranger flowers, challenge someone to a dance-off, throw an impromptu surprise party. Complete each objective then pass along the card to an unwitting accomplice, who now becomes part of the game. The fun is ever-expanding, but it all starts with you. Play it forward!

—description from the publisher

item.description:
Micro Brick Battle is a fast-paced table top strategy game using 1:120 scale models built with LEGO bricks. It is a turn-based game for two players (or teams) which continues until one side has completely destroyed the forces of the other (or otherwise completed an objective as set out in a given scenario). This book is intended to provide the basic rules for land-based armored combat. It also provides building instructions and game stats for many of the most commonly used armored vehicles of WWII.

Future expansions of the Micro Brick Battle system will include aerial combat, additional armored vehicles, and Campaign Modules for specific historic battles. We also plan to host Micro Brick Battle tournaments at events around the country starting in mid-2017. This will coincide with the release of our companion card game Bricks of War, now in development process.

Aside from the basic game rules, the bulk of this book is devoted to building instructions for the basic game piece models. This includes a short section with tips for acquiring the necessary LEGO pieces and building tips to help you complete your models. The composition of your Micro Brick Battle armies are completely up to you; whether you want to recreate historic battles or build an armored juggernaut of your own design. Brickmania will be releasing various game piece mini kits which will be compatible with the Micro Brick Battle system. These will have the added bonus of including the corresponding Bricks of War card, which will be necessary for use in the official tournament play.

This book includes instructions to build game piece models for 44 different armored vehicle from WWII.

This book includes instructions for building the following armored vehicles:

France:
Renault Ft-17
Renault R35
Char B1 Bis
Sumoa S35
Sumoa S40 (SPG)

As any Beekeeper worth their weight in wax, knows the queen is central to the health of the hive. In this fun new card game, you handle the hives as your swarm of drones and queens is flipped and rearranged. Create two colonies before your opponents do.

Game Play:
Shuffle the deck of cards. Each player draws 16 cards face down from the deck. Then, each player makes two piles of 8 cards face down (4x2 grids). These are their two hives.

On a player’s turn they will choose any card (except for their first turn where each player must choose their queen) and replace a face down card with the chosen card face up. The player will look at the card they chose and put it in the corresponding numbered location in the hive.

Players will continue to replace face down cards with each new card in their hand until you can no longer play any more cards.

If the overturned card is a queen, move it over to the other hive and start working on both hives at the same time. Once a queen is placed into a hive, she cannot be moved out. However, the queen is a wild card and can be moved around within the hive

When a player draws a card they can’t play, they discard it into the discard pile and then their turn is over.

The winner is the first person to complete two hives. Each hive must have a queen and the rest of the numbers in order and all turned face up

You've studied the footage, connected the dots, and gathered what meager evidence you could. You're close — soon the whole world will know the truth behind the Cryptid. A group of like-minded cryptozoologists have come together to finally uncover the elusive creature, but the glory of discovery is too rich to share. Without giving away some of what you know you will never succeed in locating the beast, but reveal too much and your name will be long forgotten!

Cryptid is a unique deduction game of honest misdirection in which players must try to uncover information about their opponents' clues while throwing them off the scent of their own. Each player holds one piece of evidence to help them find the creature, and on their turn they can try to gain more information from their opponents. Be warned; give too much away and your opponents might beat you to the mysterious animal and claim the glory for themselves!

The game includes a modular board, five clue books, and a deck of set-up cards with hundreds of possible set-ups across two difficulty levels. It is also supported by an entirely optional digital companion, allowing for faster game set-up and a near-infinite range of puzzles.

—description from the publisher

Note: some copies have a delta clue booklet with misprints in eight clues:

 2,#9,#13,#64 states cougar, should be bear
 3,#63,#72,#95 states bear, should be cougar




The official website with an online tool to randomly generate more clues is http://playcryptid.com/

item.description:
WWII: Full Global Conflict is a territorial strategy game covering the second world war. A variant of the Axis & Allies board game system, and a flagship game in the Empires of History game series, it offers an easy to play D10 based combat system and territories with resource values for production. More than 7 years in the making, it stands as king atop the Empires of History line of historical strategy games.

Two full color game maps present Europe, North Africa, the Middle East, Asia and the Pacific in detail. Movement between the maps is clearly defined and a comprehensive series of off map boxes contain North America, South America, the Atlantic central and lower Africa and more. One game: the entire war. With Manpower Limits, detailed technology development rules, and accurate historical detailing, Empires of History: WWII provides all of the game play quality and historical detail that gamers have come to expect from the Empires of History board game series.

With over 1700 counters, 11 nation sheets and 3 political options booklets, players assume the mantle of command of the Axis & Allied forces with an option for the US player to play with their own agenda. The game comes with a standard 1939 start for the war, but with the available political options, the game can either follow the path of the war or diverge from it fairly substantially. Limited resources like Oil Resources, Manpower Limits and difficult to defend naval sea trade resources, neither side has it easy and both should experience the desperate need for very limited resources.

A game for 2-8 players.

The perfect quiz for gaming fans. Put your knowledge to the test with this fast paced quiz game!

Contains 50 quiz cards & instructions.

In Vertellis: Relationship edition, couples ask each other questions over three rounds with the goal to stimulate conversation more than score points. That being said, some of the questions do score you points for guessing your partner's answers, much like the game show "The Newlywed Game."

Some example questions might be: "What is one activity that you don't enjoy doing, but feel relieved once you have done it?" or "Who or What has had a positive influence on your partner recently?"

From the publisher: "Mindfulness, communication, and connection come together in a compact and pleasant design. Many games come in oversized boxes, but we’ve made a point of providing you with an easily transportable, aesthetically pleasing game that will have a real impact on the table! The name "Vertellis" is derived from two Dutch words "Vertel Eens". These two words, loosely translated, mean "Tell Us More" - which is what Vertellis revolves around! Not only by answering the questions in this deck, but also by engaging and ask each other to tell more. This will result in a deeper connection with with your partner!"

Players take the part of bogans, attempting to buy and then develop their acquisitions. Income is gained by other players visiting their properties and money is spent when they visit properties belonging to other players.

Gameplay:
On their turn, the active player roll the dice and move its Beer token. When you land on a space with something to sell you can buy it with cash. Give the money to the Bogan Boss and leave one of your beer bottle cap marker tokens on the space to mark that it now belongs to you.
Each time another player lands on your space they will need to give you cash to lend the space. Liekwise, if you land on something another player own, you will have to give them cash.

There is two ways to win:
- Quick Game: As soon as someone loses all of their cash the game is over. Everyone else adds up how much they have in cash and stuff (space own on the board) and the player with the most is the winner.
- Long Game: Keep playing until all players but one have lost their cash. The remaining player is the winner.

Release your inner bogan!

Reckon youse got what it takes to sweet talk you way to some extra Centrelink payments? Can you outrun the cops in thongs? Will you pay your child support or take off to Kuta with ya mates? Well, find out in the game that’ll let you and your friends be the bogans you all wanted to be.

- Packed with Aussie Kulture.
- It’s more ocker than you
- Straya designed and developed mate.
- It’s about beer, BBQs and bludgers.
- “A dead set cracker of a game” 
- Play in your trackie daks!
- It’s unaustralian not to buy it.
- For the price of a couple of lamingtons
- Are thongs your primary footwear? Then have we got the game for youse.

You and your brother are peaceful farmers...or at least you were!

Now in Brothers, your herds are getting too big for the pasture. Outsmart your brother by placing your enclosures so he can't correctly place his and show him that you're the one with a head for cattle in the family.

—description from the publisher

item.description:
The National Bank has hidden a load of money in one of four possible locations — but you have the time to rob only one! Will you be smarter than the other players and pull off the heist of the century?

In Takers, players have five criminal cards from potentially four different locations in hand and will be able to play one per turn. Each gang is the best at robbing one place, is the second best at robbing another, and can't rob the remaining two.

At the beginning of the game, the four location cards are placed face down and one is put aside: it will be the place that will be robbed. On their turn, players can look at an incorrect location card to get info on the right one, but then they have to discard a card, having only four in hand until the end of the game, although maybe they will be able to play their cards for powers, allowing them to take back discarded cards, draw a card, then discard one,...

They can also chose to flip a jewel token. When all the jewel tokens matching the player colors have been placed face up, the game ends and players get points depending on what kind of criminals they have remaining in their hand.

item.description:
Your dream came true! You've opened your very own theme park!

Now it's up to you to help it grow by selecting the right attraction to add each turn (from a common pool with the other players) in order to improve your park's characteristics. Be smart about it because at the end of each turn, inspectors come and judge one characteristic of your park — and all of your competitors as well! Good reviews will bring more people to the best parks!

After eight turns, the park with the most visitors wins Trool Park!

item.description:
All heroes need to prove their worth! In Tales of Glory, the players play emerging heroes. Each turn represents a year in the heroes' lives, and each player decides what their hero has done that year (defeated a monster, looted treasure, met people, etc.) to try to gain glory. After ten turns, the player with the most glory wins.

Each turn, players simultaneously select a quest they want to do from a common pool. They then have to pay the cost of the quest and place it on their "path of life" connected to another quest they already made or their departure area.

Some quests such as slaying monsters bring immediate glory points while others are affected by what players have done before or will do afterwards on their path of life.

(Español)

Jóvenes héroes ansiosos de aventuras, ¡vuestro momento de gloria ha llegado! Tomad esta espada y este escudo, coged estas monedas y estas pociones. ¡Y no os olvidéis del libro de hechizos! Las tierras que estáis a punto de cruzar están llenas
de criaturas a las que vencer y tesoros que obtener. Visitarás lugares increíbles y te encontrarás con sorprendentes personajes. Volveréis a casa siendo un héroe, ¡pero solo el que alcance la gloria se convertirá en una leyenda!

En Tales of Glory construirás tu camino hacia la gloria mediante la adquisición de cartas que te permitirán ir creando tu senda, luchando con monstruos, ganando poder y reclutando aliados que te ayudarán a obtener el prestigio para ganar la partida. El sistema de elección de carta al azar le ofrece una profundidad táctica donde averiguar en qué momento una carta es interesante para tu senda o para la de tus oponentes.

item.description: Partners+ is a six-player (three-pair) version of Partners. Like in Partners, the object of the game is to move one's men from home to the target area as fast as possible. They are moved in a clockwise direction along the course according to the value of the cards. The winning player or team is the one who has first placed all its men in the target area.

Ultimate Soldier Reloaded is a fast paced strategic card game for 2 to 4 players. Each player commands highly trained soldiers that engage in combat against the other players. Your mission is to win three times in battle or earn four soldiers the fastest and become the Ultimate Soldier.

Ultimate Soldier Reloaded (2017) is a brand new edition of the first edition Ultimate Soldier (2013), and is quite different from the original because it features upgraded artwork, all-new mechanics, and new characters.

The Ultimate Soldier Reloaded box comes with instructions plus 133 game cards:

 14 Soldier cards
 9 Weapon cards
 32 Training cards
 59 Action cards
 4 Intensity cards
 2 Sniper cards
 9 Special cards
 Reference cards




Each player has their own soldiers, which they'll use to engage in combat against the other players. Players take turns in clockwise order, and on your turn you first draw a card from the common deck, and then do one of the following:

 Play a Training card
 Initiate combat
 Discard a card




To win, you need to get four soldier cards, or win three times in battle.

Tales of Resurrection is a cooperative civilization boardgame for 1-6 players.

TOR is a cooperative Strategy-game in which players must build and develop their settlement in a story-driven campaign. Choose one of 3 individual Paths with unique and exciting quests for you to play. Over 30 hours of playtime are guaranteed on your journey through Adra!

Fight and kill an ancient monster to be the next leader of Adra!

As before, players will build up their dungeon (with graphics inspired by classic videogames) in order to lure in heroes and defeat them before they reach your boss. New mechanisms such as the all new miniboss room cards will power up your dungeon in insidious new ways, and wreak havoc on your opponents' dungeons.

—description from the publisher

In Galaxy Hunters, 2 to 4 players take on the role of mercenaries hired by the Megacorps to hunt and harvest the rampant mutations. Featuring an inventive pilot and mech combination system, pairing different pilots with different mechs unlocks new powers and special abilities. Using money earned for harvesting DNA from the creatures, players upgrade their mechs with new weapons and items. Galaxy Hunters seamlessly blends the excitement of crafting a unique character with the deep strategy of Eurogame-style worker placement.

—description from the publisher

name.value: Konigsberg: The Soviet Attack on East Prussia, 1945

item.description:
Konigsberg: The Soviet Attack on East Prussia, 1945 simulates the Soviet Attack by the 2nd and 3rd Belorussian Fronts on elements of Army Group Center in January, 1945.

Each corps and army is represented by an activation chit and each side has a limited number of activation's they can use in a turn. This leads to players uncertain as to when or if formations will move or fight when they want.

The Soviets offensive is mobile but quickly out paces its infantry and HQ's, random events can ground the Soviet Air Force or Stalin may intervene and delay some formations.

The Germans units get hit hard and each move is critical to blocking the Soviets from the critical cities of Elbing and Konigsberg. Your motorized formations can be hit by no gas or the Gross Deutchland could withdraw when you need these units to defend a critical location.

Can you replicate the epic defense of Konigsberg or will the Soviet onslaught win the day?

Game Scale:
Game Turn: 2 days
Hex: 5 miles / 8 kilometers
Units: Kampfgruppe to Corps

Game Inventory:
One 22 x 34" full color map
One dual-side printed countersheet (280 1/2" counters)
One 12-page Konigsberg rulebook
One Cover Sheet/Player Aid Card
One Plastic zipper bag

Solitaire Playability: High
Complexity Level: Medium
Players: 2 or more
Playing Time: 4-10 hours

Note Players will need to provide one 6-sided die and one container with which to draw out Command & Activation chits.

After a long captivity you and your companions have an opportunity to recover freedom. You are imprisoned in a spaceship abandoned by your captors. You were abducted to be exhibited in a traveling alien circus, but now that the ship is about to become uninhabitable, your kidnappers have simply opened the cells and fled.

Kenophobia is a game of exploration and survival of 2 to 4 players with a duration of 40 minutes.
Each player will lead a group of five abductees through the corridors and compartments of the ship. The objective is to drive them to some of the exit locks before they lose all air or are self-destructing. The abductees must explore the environment to find the most direct route to the center of the ship, where the vacuum suits that allow them to leave it. Along the way, they can investigate, looking in the compartments for equipment that will help them achieve their goal.
They will soon discover that they are not alone. Other victims accompany them in their race for salvation. But they can not expect any help from them. Their appearance is mutually repulsive and there is also fear. The fear of the vacuum of space.

OBJECTIVE OF THE GAME: to draw the maximum number of units equipped with a vacuum suit through one of the four locks of the ship before the air runs out (when no more exploration tiles are left) or before the ship is self-destructed (when the countdown reaches the last turn).

A player can perform a maximum of two actions during his turn.
Each of the 5 abductees that manages can only be activated once per turn. That is, each unit can only perform one action per turn. The units can act together or alone.
An abductee activated by the player can perform one of the following actions:

 Explore box in white
 Move on ship and explored shippacks
 Investigate ship sticker




—description from the designer

A choose-your-own-adventure boardgame. You are one of King Charles' Paladins and you are looking for Angelica, princess of Catai, kidnapped by an evil wizard. The setting is Orlando Furioso, a magnificient poem by Renassaince poet Ludovico Ariosto, both epic and humorous at the same time.
Move on the board and see what happens in a gamebook-like set of 202 paragraphs. Combats are solved by dice. Tokens are used to assure that things happening will influence your future. Cards for special and magic items keel special rules always at hand.

item.description:
Royal Conquest is largely based on an old Korean card game called Go-Stop. Match cards from you hand to those on the table and form winning combinations to score points. Call STOP once you've earned the minimum points and win the hand. Or call GO if you think you can make at least one more point before another player can make a call.

Stay alert because another player may have an Action card that could stop you from winning the game. The addition of Action cards gives this game its unique gameplay.

If you win a hand, you receive Gems based on number of players and how many times a "GO" was called. Once all the Gems are gone from the Gem pot, the player with the most Gems wins the game.

item.description:
A game of Eclipse places you in control of a vast interstellar civilization, competing for success with its rivals. You explore new star systems, research technologies, and build spaceships with which to wage war. There are many potential paths to victory, so you need to plan your strategy according to the strengths and weaknesses of your species, while paying attention to the other civilizations' endeavors.

Eclipse: Second Dawn for the Galaxy is a revised and upgraded version of the Eclipse base game that debuted in 2011 that features:


 New graphic design, while maintaining the acclaimed symbology of the first edition

 Custom combat dice
 Fine-tuned gameplay

item.description:
Streets of Steel is a 1-4 player co-operative sidescroller, where players brawl their way through baddies in a 1980's-esque, pixelated, post-apocalyptic, degenerate cityscape. Fight filthy Punks, hot-headed Firebugs, and elusive Killgaroos (yup, ninja kangaroos) in order to take down the big boss, Super Mutie.

This is a fast paced and funny game with interesting new boardgame mechanics and lots of reverence for 16-bit, arcade fighting.

The game is for 1-4 players, and plays in under an hour. Players will join together to beat down waves of baddies by rolling lots of dice, risking lots of resources, busting crates, using items and defeating the big boss. After each full round of Hero and Baddie activations, the game board sidescrolls… everything on the first tile dies as it is removed, and then a new tile pops in and spawns another wave of baddies. Players choose their own difficulty by starting the game with a limited number of quarters. Make it to the Boss, or die trying, as you try to clean up the STREETS OF STEEL!

—description from the publisher

https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/wildpower/streets-of-steel-the-sidescrollin-beatem-up-boardg?ref=user_menu

https://www.facebook.com/wildpowergames/?ref=bookmarks

Take 5 & Take A Number combines 6 nimmt! and X nimmt! in a single box.

In 6 nimmt!, you want to score as few points as possible. To play the game, you shuffle the 104 number cards, lay out four cards face-up to start the four rows, then deal ten cards to each player. Each turn, players simultaneously choose and reveal a card from their hand, then add the cards to the rows, with cards being placed in ascending order based on their number; specifically, each card is placed in the row that ends with the highest number that's below the card's number. When the sixth card is placed in a row, the owner of that card claims the other five cards and the sixth card becomes the first card in a new row.

In addition to a number from 1 to 104, each card has a point value. After finishing ten rounds, players tally their score and see whether the game ends because someone has passed a particular point threshold. When this happens, the player with the fewest points wins!

X nimmt! starts with the same premise as 6 nimmt!, but changes these rules a few ways. Each player starts with eight cards in hand and a personal X row. Played cards will be placed into three rows, with those rows being able to hold three, four or five cards. Whenever someone takes cards from a row, those cards go into the player's hand, then the player must play one card into their personal X row.

All cards in this X row must also be played in ascending order! If you can't do this, then you place all of those X cards aside in order to start a new X row, with the value of those set-aside cards now being doubled.

A round ends after someone plays the final card in their hand, and whoever has the fewest negative points after two rounds wins.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

From the rear of the box:
Since its creation in 1992 LPR has become Europe's No. 2 pallet pooling operator exclusively dedicated to the fast-moving consumer goods sector, handling more than 40 million pallet movements a year.

With subsidiaries in 7 countries (France, Spain, Portugal, Benelux, United Kingdom, Germany and Italy), LPR offers an end-to-end delivery and collection service throughout Western Europe. It has a network of some eighty depots and collects pallets from 20,000 drop-off points across Europe.

LPR offers a fully outsourced solution with high-quality pallets that are entirely compatible with automated production and picking systems. The LPR product range includes all types of pallet used by manufacturers of fast-moving consumer goods and by major retailers.

LPR has a team of experienced professionals, ready to provide tailor-made responses for individual customers, with solutions that are simple, innovative and flexible.

PROPERTIES
BROWN
Flint / Barrow
LIGHT BLUE
LPR Benelux / LPR Germany / Lpr Italy
PINK
West Hallam / Temple Patrick / Avonmouth
ORANGE
Leeming Bar / Folkstone / Mossend

LPR Portugal / LPR Spain / LPR France
YELLOW
Chorley / Wrexham / Kegworth
GREEN
Dublin / Clonmel / Longford
DARK BLUE
Redditch / Toulouse
STATIONS

UTILITIES

TAXES
One Way Trip Fee / ISPM 15 Charge

This version is very special for two reasons:

1. It is the first "square box" edition that has been created by anyone else apart from Hasbro. (The square box (called the "Number 9") makes a much better version than the rectangle, for corporate gifts. It was always a no go but now companies can now have their own version of this – thanks to LPR.)

2. LPR commissioned their own playing pieces; a lorry and a pallet! (This is the first time a company has done this in the UK.)

The Red Queen looms large over Wonderland, with many monsters and other frightful things at her command. Alice and her friends must do their best to ward off the Red Queen's influence and restore peace.

In Wonderland, you choose to play as either Alice or the Red Queen. Place your cards carefully to control areas of Wonderland while taking advantage of your magic items. Once all the cards have been placed, the magic items modify the value of adjacent cards. Score the final board based on the arrangement of the cards. The player with the most points wins!

link.value: Guild: Game Designers of North Carolina

item.description: In Manga Kai, players each receive a hand of double-sided cards, then they attempt to trade with one another as quickly as they can in order to claim objective cards on the table. Once you feel that you've traded and scored all that you can, you need to convince others to end the game. Once at least half of the players feel they're finished, everyone else has the length of one 45-second sand timer in which to conclude their trade and score any final points. Whoever scores the most wins!

item.description:
Vote ME! is a vocal party game for three or more players, split into Parties and can take from about 10-15 minutes (3 round game, a few players) up to 90 minutes (9 rounds, 7+ players).

Each round has three steps:

1) Draw cards - the area card that is being contested and the Policy and Theme card for the round

2) Give speeches - one player from each party has to give a 1 minute speech based on the rounds Policy and Theme

3) All players vote for the Party (other than their own) that they thought gave the best speech. The Party with the most votes wins the area card.

At the end of the game, the Party with the most area cards wins.

The Policy cards cover things you would normally expect to see in an election, and are there to provide a focus for the speech. The Theme cards provide additional flavor for the speech content, and normally, only the title of the Theme card is used, with the 6 options used as inspiration. However, if you want to add a bit more of a challenge to your game, you can roll a dice and use the corresponding option to the number rolled as the theme.

Theme
Utopia, according to Sir Thomas More, is a model society in all aspects. This educational game is built upon the Utopian ideal as well as the practical matters in real life such as making a living, setting a family, investment, etc. Through Utopia players realize the importance of opportunities, knowledge and possessions in attaining personal goals.

Gameplay
The game is divided into 7 cycles, starting at 15-20 (years) and ending at retirement. Each player chooses a Chart of Personal Possessions, a colored horse head marker and receives $3000. Placing their horse head at the bottom left corner of the starting zone, players roll two six sided dice and move the number of spaces equal to the difference between the two numbers. If doubles are rolled, players earn either money or a Utopia card as indicated by the chart printed on the board. At the end of each cycle (circuit of the board), players received a Utopian card and $1200 or their salary.

Goal
The goal of the game is to be the person who retires with the most points based on markers, money and price of property owned.

item.description:
Objective: To be the first player to get 5 chips in a row horizontally, vertically or diagonally.

How to Play: Each player selects 1 color of chips and may use only 1 chip per turn. Players take turns rolling the dice and must use all 3 dice. With any sequence or combination, players add, subtract, multiply and divide the 3 numbers to reach a number that will help them get 5 chips in a row while blocking their opponents from doing the same.

If a player rolls 3 dice of the same number (triplets), he plays that roll and gets an additional turn. If he rolls triplets again (on the same turn) he removes from the board 1 chip of each opponent, and the next person takes his turn. The first player to get 5 chips in a row horizontally, vertically, or diagonally wins.

There are 4 Levels of play – Progressive Skill Builder

Introductory: Play entire board
Basic: Play within Blue Lines
Intermediate: Play within Green Lines
Advanced: Play within Red Lines

The game, Do Not Die, is a tile game that focuses on managing player vitals and resources while simply trying to stay alive and find rescue.

Players can build shelters, loot cabins, hunt and fish for food, even cozy up to a nice campfire. But make no mistake, the goal here is survival. Players must stay alive and find their way out, even if that means player vs. player combat.

"Do Not Die" is fast paced and exciting with deep complexity and many available strategies. It makes all players compete against each other but also has the game itself as the primary challenger.

The mechanics involved push the players forward and if they lose sight of their primary objective, survival becomes impossible. It can also be played cooperatively, eventually joining player tiles. The game even has a vast and engaging solitary mode for single player action. (Game length = 60 minutes / Players = 1-5 / Ages = 10+)

This turn-based game uses Player Boards where each player manages four individual vitals; Temperature, Hunger, Thirst, & Fatigue. At the end of their turn, each player adds up the HP damage associated with each vital and subtracts it from their health meter. The Health Meter starts at thirty and once the player reaches zero, they lose.

The game also has a Main Game Board. The Main Game Board has Player Cards that sets the environment for each player and Weather Cards that control the weather for the day. Distributed in the Weather Deck, there are six Exposure Cards that increase the Exposure Level. This Exposure Level lowers each players vitals at the beginning of each player turn. The player must perform six actions each turn to try to counteract this effect and manage their vitals to avoid dying.

There are sixty-four tiles in this game that the player uncovers by using actions to explore their surroundings. They consist of the following:

Frozen Ground Tile - Used for hunting Varment for food +1
Frozen Lake Tile - Used for Fishing for food +1
Forest Tile - Used for hunting Small Game for food +4
Mountain Tile - Used for hunting Large Game for food +6
Cabin Tile - Used for looting Tools and Items
Fire Tower Tile - Used for Rescue

In order to gain helpful resources in the game, the player can craft things like campfires, shelters, water, and some simple tools using player actions. Other Items and Tools can be found in the game by revealing a Cabin Tile and looting it. Each player can only loot a revealed cabin once. When a cabin is looted, the player rolls one black die (for an Item Card) and two white dice (for Tool Cards). If they roll an even number, then they select the corresponding Tool or Item Cards from the decks. The goal always remains, Do Not Die.

In Axis & Allies & Zombies, a new take on the iconic World War II strategy board game, each player takes command of one of the major powers, joining either the Axis or the Allies. Players then fight for victory against the opposing faction and a terrifying new foe: zombies. In this game that features streamlined game play, curveballs like chainsaw tanks and zombie mind control rays, and a zany storyline, will players survive the onslaught or succumb to the uprising?

—description from the publisher

item.description:
The 15 pawns are placed in the first line of the game board, indicated with an arrow. The pawns may move one space per turn or jump over as many opposite pawns as possible. Jumped over pawns are removed from the game as are pawns that don't jump when it is possible to do so. Movement and jumping on ones own side of the gameboad is only forward or sideward. On the opponents side of the game board moving and jumping is allowed in any direction.

The player who gets the most pawns onto the opposite half of the game board wins the game.

This is a roll-and-move-game. The players start at home (numbered houses). Then they have to go to the fire station, where they get a blue card with their mission order. On the way to their mission location they don't have to mind any obstacles, but on the way back to the fire station, if they land on a red spot, they have to draw a red mission card. The blue spots mark traffic jams where movement is only one spot per turn.

The first player back to the fire station wins the game.
The last player has to tidy away the game.

Four renowned opportunists are hired to obtain the world’s rarest gemstones that were once derived from all over the world and are kept in an exclusive place, protected for thousands of years by a native tribe.

It will be no easy task to retrieve the stones. The four opportunists must venture, not fully aware of the dangers, into a subterranean labyrinth. Seeking what they believe are rare gems, they soon discover the stones contain elemental powers. Threatened, they find themselves maneuvering quickly through warp portals, battling natives, and avoiding traps in an ever-changing maze. Escaping could prove problematic with a monstrous guardian willing to kill to protect its undisturbed dwelling. But returning to Centershaft and getting out alive is of most importance!

Centershaft Fallen Elements is a strategy tile-based thematic board game. In the game, players will explore the labyrinth to recover Element tokens. The goal of the game is to be the first to collect one of each Element token and then be the first to return to the Centershaft Hub tile.

On a player's turn they will draw from the event deck, resolve the card by following the instructions on the card (battling monsters, for example) or if it allows, they may keep to use at a later turn. They will also resolve any current cards they possess or abilities they have before they move their character miniature.

name.value: Questo e Quello: i colori degli animali

item.description:
Each player on his turn plays a puzzle piece out of his hand of three. A piece can be played if it can be "associated" with at least one of the other pieces already on the table, along one of the two "variables" of the game.

The two "variables" are the color of each animal (white, black, brown, pink, green, white/black) and how it moves (two-legged, four-legged, flying, swimming).

The two pegs of each puzzle piece only allows the interlocking with another piece belonging to the right category. For example, the panther can be associated with the gorilla (because they're both black) or with the polar bear (because they have four legs).

But how do you win? Making the winning combinations before opponents, which are in all five different types and give different scores.

The winning combinations and the corresponding prize tokens that you earn to keep track of the points are explained in detail in the rules of the game, but an example of a winning combination can be to complete a row playing the fourth and last animal of pink color, or completing a column by attaching the sixth and last animal that flies ... Easy, right?

Welcome to Panzer Orders Western Front, a World War 2 card game. This is a stand alone game for solitaire and two-players and is fully compatible with the other Panzer Orders games and expansions.

The game is quick to setup and play, it takes around 30 minutes to play a game and comes complete with everything you need. Each card has a points value based on the card characteristics and special rules. The players agree a point based battle and then build their decks, spending points on specific cards.

Each player must form three columns of any mixture of vehicles, tanks, or infantry and then attack the opponents columns. The first player to defeat all three columns or force the opposing player to draw their last card, wins the game. During the player turn you can choose to dig and defend with your card, moves cards from one column to another or attack with ling range or close combat. Non of these are without their risks and weighing up the risk vs the strategic gain is part of the decision making elements of the game.

Combat is fast, simple but very brutal with all the dice rolls required on the cards - no charts or looking up in the rules. Damaged cards are suppressed first before being removed from the game and can still make a free saving throw on the dice to keep in the fight.

In the first half of the 20th century in Mexico, local promotions bring to light new masked heroes with the birth of a new cultural phenomenon: Lucha Libre! Impersonate those pioneers in their conquest of the crowds by inventing and popularizing new match types!

A race for innovation takes place: inventing new match types rewards you with Glory Masks, but popularizing an already invented match can also make you steal it from your opponent. When a player popularizes 2 different match styles, the game ends.

On a given turn, a player will first get the chance to hire the best available Luchadores from the Lucha Gym to join their Promotion. Then, players are invited to choose between actions to build their Promotion or to challenge rival promotions by proposing a match. When choosing to build, a player can hire managers, invent new match styles, create Championship titles or use their Luchadores's family influence to collect member of the same family/clan.

When proposing a match, rivals have to match the style of your match-chosen luchadores in order to answer your challenge. If a successful Luchadores matching is made, players will go head to head in a dice rolling battle to earn the 3 count!

The Promotion having the most Glory Masks at the end of the game is declared the winner! Bonuses are given to the first player having completed the race, for each family/clan re-united and for each Championship Belt won in the matches. In that regard, the game proposes multiple strategies and paths to victory. With the memorization aspect of the families and wrestlers style, as well as the quick game turns, there is no downtime and plenty of room for strategy.

300 Spartans: The 9 Card Thermopylae Game is a solitaire micro wargame. In the game, you will control the Persian forces and must fight the small band of Spartans warriors who are blocking your path at the Thermopylae pass. All units on the board are represented by dice which are rotated to show their current strength. You goal is to eliminate all the Spartan units so that Xerxes army can use the pass and continue their invasion of Greece.

The game uses a simplified Command and Colors system similar to C&C Ancients or The Great War. Each turn you will draw two cards and choose one to use to command certain troops on the board and one to use for its tactical event. Each card also has a Spartan Event, which will modify the way they fight and give them advantages against your troops.

The game is played using a total of 9 cards, 16 dice, and 2 cubes. One card contains the map for the game, another the turn and status tracks, and the other seven cards contain the game's activations and events. Each of those card has three sections on it 1.) Persian Command 2.) Persian Tactics and 3.) Spartan Event. You will only need to look at the relevant event for the current phase of the game.

Each turn is played out in a series of phases.
1. Card Draw Phase
2. Spartan Event Phase
3. Tactics Phase
4. Command Phase
5. Spartan Attack Phase
6. Victory or Loss Check Phase
7. End of Day Phase

Despite the small number of components and short playing time, the game presents a challenging experience and interesting historical narrative for this famous battle. Can you beat the historical result and lead your Persian soldiers to victory over the Greeks with minimal Persian casualties? Or will your soldiers get massacred by the Spartan war machine?

link.value: 9 Card Game Print and Play Design Contest

item.description:
King of Liriam is a tactical & strategic, cutthroat area control boardgame for 2-4 players in which players take the role of medieval house lords that want to conquer the fantastical realm called Liriam.

On their turn, players spend gold to buy units, orders, neutral forces or buildings from the deployment panel. The higher an item is on the deployment panel the higher the cost players must pay, but sometimes the cost must be paid to get out of a tricky situation, or gain an undisputed advantage.

Once players decide what to buy they must deploy the item on the map of Liriam and this is where the tactical and strategical layers surface in King of Liriam. Each unit features a combination of 2 traits, the way it enters the map and the ability it performs once arrived. For instance units can conquer new territories, patrol existing ones, or siege nearby enemy settlements.

The goal of the game is to own more territories than the enemy by the time the map fills.

Fluxx is a card game in which the cards themselves determine the current rules of the game. By playing cards, you change numerous aspects of the game: how to draw cards, how to play cards, and even how to win.

At the start of the game, each player holds three cards and on a turn a player draws one card, then plays one card. By playing cards, you can put new rules into play that change numerous aspects of the game: how many cards to draw or play, how many cards you can hold in hand or keep on the table in front of you, and (most importantly) how to win the game. There are many editions, themed siblings, and promo cards available.

In Star Wars Fluxx, you will find yourself in the thick of battles for a distant galaxy. Draw a card, play a card, shoot from the Death Star, and use the Force. But remember that the rules can change at any time and then, by joining the Emperor, you will save the Rebel Alliance from defeat.

item.description:
Summary
Players form a hidden pattern of 4 colors with their cubes and try to form 3 unique instances of their hidden pattern on the Matrix while simultaneously trying to solve their Rivals' patterns and block them.

Goal
To form 3 copies of your hidden pattern on the pixel grid

Setup
Form a pattern of 4 unique colors from the cube pile and keep it hidden from the other players E.g. Red, Blue, Green, Yellow

Gameplay
The player with the most colorful shirt goes first and places 1 cube of any color onto the board. Gameplay then proceeds clockwise. On their turn, each player must place 1 cube of any color orthogonally adjacent to another existing cube.
Pun Intended is for pun-loving people everywhere! Teams have 1 minute to solve 6 puns that all start with the same letter and score points for each correct pun. The first team to 30 points wins!

You are a vampire, werewolf, or zombie trying to take over the city. Deploy recruits to overrun strategic locations, but be careful... If the competing factions discover your true allegiance, they can send monsters to destroy you in your own lair!

Bitten is a social deduction game with card drafting. Players do not know who is on their team, or if they even have a teammate. After drafting recruits, players place their recruits in the city attempting to overrun locations or in other players' lairs to prevent them from winning.

—description from the publisher

item.description:
Spots is a traditional Irish card game. A bit similar to Rummy, but older. Designed for four players, but can be played with three players using a 'dead hand' or with five players if the dealer 'sits out'.

Using a standard 52-card deck, each player is given eight cards and each turn a player must first draw a card from either the deck or the discard pile. A maximum of four cards may be laid on the table, either as a new set or connected to any existing set. At the end of the turn a player must discard a card from hand. Thus each player can make no more then two sets each game.

When a player has no more cards or when the deck is depleted, the game ends and players receive penalty points for all cards in hand. These are equal to the number of spots on each card, hence the name of the game. To clarify: Ace=1, 2=2, 3=3..., jack/queen/king=10 penalty points.

Additional rules: The ace is always low, so cannot go behind a king of the same suit. A player may play a double, which is extremely rare. These are exactly eight connecting cards of the same suit. The discard pile may not be spread out but the deck may be in order to know how many turns may be left.

item.description:
Suomi 1918 is a quick and easy-to-learn card game about the birth of the Finnish state and the civil war and the events that led to it. Can history have unfolded differently?

The game consists of a deck of 49 cards, of which 7 are victory condition cards. The remaining cards represent significant places, people, events, and social conditions during the civil war. These are in 4 colored suits: black (social turmoil), blue (peace efforts), red (socialists), and white (conservatives).

Players each have a secret victory condition representing a goal of either the Reds or the Whites. They take turns placing cards in increasing sequential order onto 4 central piles (one for each suit) and try to achieve their victory condition without the state collapsing (completing the black pile) or reaching peace through compromise (completing the blue pile). Special event cards can also cause the top card of a pile to be discarded, temporarily stalling progress.

A dexterity game for any number of persons - engrossing, dynamic and entertaining.

The ball is placed in the hollow provided in the launching pad. The pad is then slightly pressed down and released suddenly. If the ball passes through a hole in the turret and falls through it, the number of points won is that marked on the hole plus that marked on the hollow in the field the ball comes to rest in.

The players can either agree on a certain number of rounds or on a certain figure to be reached.

I Spy Fish is a 3-in-1 family cardgame including 48 oversized picture cards for 1-6 players.

In three different game modes players try to collect matching pairs by asking other players for cards (I SPY FISH), by grabbing open cards from the table (SNAP), or by flipping two cards on the table (MEMO).

Sojourn is a single player game about time travel. Throughout the course of the game, the player travels from destination to destination, opening up destination portals to different places in time while trying to retrieve time sphere fragments in order to build a machine that will allow them to go home. The player does have more than random chance on their side, however, as they can choose to play timestream cards that allow them to manipulate the flow of time.

—description from the publisher

item.description: You know how, when you're sitting around with friends, you inevitably start telling old stories and unofficially trying to one up each other? This game takes that typical night and turns it into a competitive event. Players tell their best true life stories on the card topic and try to one up each other. Players vote on the best story - the person with the most votes wins the round. The person who wins the most rounds is crowned the One Upper.

In Rice Dice, a streamlined version of Spirits of the Rice Paddy, you roll the custom dice and choose one action based on the results: add rice paddy cards to your field, run water through your paddies, assign laborers to plant and harvest, or add weeds to opponents' fields. Harvesting gains players rice, which is essential to win, but paddies with weeds produce less rice, so it's essential to assign laborers to keep paddies clean. A harvested paddy can once again be flooded using a water action, then the cycle of planting, draining, weeding, and harvesting begins again.

The first player to collect 100 rice (via harvesting, or other special abilities) wins!

Like Spirits of the Rice Paddy, Rice Dice rewards a player's ability to optimize the process of flooding, planting, weeding, and harvesting — but it plays in just a fraction of the time!

item.description:
ENGLISH:

The objective of the game is to block your opponent's pawn.

To start, each player will place his pawn on the starting space. The pawn will only move one space in any direction to an adjacent empty space.

Each player in his turn will make to actions:

- Move his own pawn one space
- Move a counter trying to block your opponent's pawn.

This first to block his opponent's pawn will be the winner.

				
					===========================

SPANISH;

El objetivo del juego será inmovilizar al peón contrario.

Al comenzar la partida cada jugador colocará su peón en un lado del tablero. El peón sólo podrá trasladarse a una casilla inmediata, en cualquier dirección, siempre que no esté ocupada.

En cada turno un jugador tendrá que: desplazar el peón una casilla y colocar una ficha tratando de obstaculizar al peón contrario.

El ganador será el primero que consiga bloquear al peón contrario.

item.description:
A 13×13 variant of Chinese chess, originally invented by artist and designer Chen Wei in 1987, then redeveloped and awarded a design patent in 2009. Each player has 12 pieces corresponding to the 12 animals of the Chinese zodiac.

Each piece moves in a different way, appropriate to the type of animal, for example, the snake moves in an S-shape. The object of the game is to checkmate the dragon, which is the equivalent to the king or general in Chinese chess.

The name given to this game in Chinese is "ä¸­å›½æ£‹" which literally means "Chinese chess". (The game known in English as Chinese chess is called "è±¡æ£‹", "elephant chess", in Chinese.)

The gameboard for Chinese Zodiac chess is the subject of Chinese utility model patents CN303396390S, CN301049385 and CN87300760.

The Beautiful Game: TCG (Trading Card Game) is a tabletop board game incorporating an optional trading card system to introduce more player cards and tactical 'Event Cards'. It is a 2 player game that can be played for any duration, but it is recommended that players play 60 or 90 minutes, broken down into two halves.

The game starts with players choosing their teams. In the Kick Off Edition, players will draft their teams face-up from the pool of players. The player cards are then assigned to a number which corresponds to a player piece on the pitch. The game is then played using the stats on the player cards and rolls of the D20 against these stats when necessary to perform certain actions such as shooting or tackling. The game is quick and fluid to play and involves no measuring of distances other than counting spaces on the pitch.

Extra tactics and gameplay elements are introduced to the game via 'Event Cards' – a 50 card (minimum) deck of cards that can help you or hinder your opponent. The Kick Off Edition features pre-constructed Event Card decks.

When playing the game, the player in possession of the ball (the attacking player) leads play but the defending player is still heavily involved in influencing how the attacker can play. The defending player chooses to try mark attackers and can play Event cards to hinder their chances in order to try win back possession.

The winner is the player who has scored the most goals at the end of the game!

—description from the publisher

Based in an alternate Earth, Malifaux uses gothic, steampunk, and victorian horror with a dose of the wild west to inject fun and depth into the magical lawlessness of a world rife with monsters, necropunks, man-machine hybrids, gunslingers, and powerhungry politicos. Actively using character-driven stories to define the world of Malifaux, seek your fortune in this fast paced and brutal 32mm tabletop miniature skirmish game. Assemble your crew and stake your claim!

This rules manual includes an expanded index and provides all of the rules which you need to play Malifaux Second Edition in one compact volume. Grab your Fate Deck, it's time to cheat fate or lose your soul...

—description from the publisher

The sun beat down as a dry wind swept over the small desert town. Squinting his eyes, the bartender looked out across the dusty horizon. Hundreds of varmints were closing in. The little monsters had to be dealt with; it was time to call in help.

Overview
Varmint is a flicking-based dexterity game for 2-6 players that can be carried in your pocket. The goal is for one player to capture the most varmints. This is accomplished by flicking disks at, and hitting, varmint cards (and if you’re really devious, at your opponent's hero cards). Each hero has its own unique special ability that affects game play.

Winning the Game
Once the end phase of the final round has been completed, the player with the most captured (face up) varmints cards wins.

The food wheel is a graphical representation that helps to combine the foods that should be part of your daily diet.
It is a circular symbol that divides into groups of different sizes and gather foods with similar nutritional properties. The purpose of this game is to form sets of cards according to categories of the new food wheel and thus acquire points and win the game.
With the mechanic of card drafting (pick one card from hand to play and pass the remaining cards to next player. Process repeated until last card is played).
Cards are played on the table, in front of each player. This table area it’s called "Kitchen".
There are three types of cards.
Food cards - 7 different colours. The number of cards varies depending on its category. The goal is to collect as many different cards in the same category.
In the end, the cards will also be scored for diversity of categories. Who have more colours gets more points.
Water cards - Light blue cards. The objective is to higher number of cards to gain water points.
Character cards (cooker, waiter and doctor nutritionist) - These are action cards that are played to affect the course of the game.
Once played, these action cards go directly to the trash.
Players canot repeat food cards in his kitchens (repeated cards are sent to the trash) and all the food cards that went to the trash result in an loss of points for that player.
In the end of the game the player with the most number of points wins the game.

Use 9 balls to hit 9 characters, the more distance away the more points.

You can remove characters as you go or leave them on the ground for a bit of a challenge

"What is STOOPID The Card Game?"

"STOOPID is the glorious absence of common sense."

In STOOPID The Card Game, you the player use (BURN) your common sense to play an array of cards that you draw from your deck and play from your hand. These cards have all kinds of effects that cause damage or hinder the other players in some way. You can even call on your neighbors to come fight at your side.

There are 5 card types in the STOOPID Core Deck; each one does something different.


 Accidents
 Happenings
 Neighbors
 Skirmish
 Things


The goal of STOOPID is to use your cards to knock the other player(s) health down to zero and out of the game. But are they?!.

When playing STOOPID with 3 or more players, the players that get "knocked out” become ghosts. As ghosts they use their Skirmish (red) cards to haunt the players that are still alive.

—description from the publisher

link.value: STOOPID! The Card Game: Brain Dead
STOOPID! The Card Game: The Ghost Deck

item.description:
Welcome, sports fans! Blitz Bowl is a fast-paced sports game that pits two teams against each other in a battle to achieve touchdowns, complete challenges, and score the most points through a mixture of skill, luck and aggression!

The teams are smaller and the games are faster than in Blood Bowl, but the action is just as intense as each player seeks to distinguish themselves in the eyes of Nuffle in the infamous Crush recruitment rituals.

The game features a number of elements that will be familiar to fans of Blood Bowl, meaning that the two games are ideal companions to each other. Players should expect to complete a game of Blitz Bowl within an hour and considerably less once they have a good grasp of the rules, making for a thrilling quick-play experience.

link.value: Blitz Bowl: Dark Elf Player Cards

item.description:
The big MOVIE NIGHT contains four different games: Charades, Movie Quiz, Soundtrack Quiz and Who Am I?

CHARADES.

BEFORE YOU GET STARTED: Split the players into even teams and make sure you have a pen and paper to record your scores.

RULES FOR PLAY: Draw a card from the pile. Roll the dice and mime the charade listed next to the number you've rolled. Start the egg timer. Your team must correctly guess the charade you are miming before the egg timer runs out. If they do, your team wins a point. If not, the next team in line can take a guess. If they guess correctly, they take the point.

INDICATING THE CATAGORY:
Films - Pretend you are cranking an old fashioned movie camera.
TV - Draw a rectangle with your index finger.
Books - Pretend to unfold your hands as if they were a book opening.
Songs - Pretend to sing into a microphone.
To indicate how many words are in the charade, hold the correct number of fingers against your opposite arm.

MIMING: To mime is to use only gestures and movements to act out, it does NOT include speaking, mouthing words or verbalising in any form! You may not indicate objects within the place you are playing to help your teammates.

WINNING THE GAME: The first team to reach 15 points wins.

MOVIE AND SOUNDTRACK QUIZZES.

BEFORE YOU GET STARTED: Split the players into even teams and make sure you have a pen and paper to record your scores.

RULES FOR PLAY: The beginning team draws a card, asks the other team a question and starts the egg timer. The players in the team are allowed to confer and must answer the question before the egg timer runs out. 1 point is awarded for each correct answer.

WINNING THE GAME: The first player or team to reach 15 points is the winner.

WHO AM I?

BEFORE YOU GET STARTED: Make sure you have pens and paper to record your scores.

RULES FOR PLAY: Place the cards face down in a pile. each player picks a card from the pack. Without loking at it, use the headbands provided to secure it so that the other players can clearly see the name on the card. On each card is the name of a famous person, the player becomes that person for the round until they guess their identity. Each player takes turns to ask a question such as, "Am I female?", "Am I alive?", "Did I invent something?", ect. Each player takes turns to ask a question. If the player guesses their identity using 5 question or less, they get 3 points. If they guess using between 6 and 10 questions, they get 2 points. Between 11 and 15 questions gets 1 point and if the player does not guess who they are within 15 questions, they score no points.

WINNING THE GAME: The first player to reach 15 points wins.

name.value: Space Marine Adventures: Labyrinth of the Necrons
Space Marine Adventures: Im Labyrinth Der Necrons

item.description:
The Necron Overlord has arisen, and he seeks to take over the galaxy! Standing between this tyrannical maniac and his ultimate prize are five Space Marine heroes - mighty battle-brothers who have sworn to halt his evil plans.

Space Marine Adventures is a fast-paced cooperative game for 1-4 players, pitting a squad of brave Space Marine warriors against the menace of the alien Overlord and his robotic footsoldiers in the dark and dangerous labyrinth of the Necrons.

There are three levels to complete, each offering a different challenge. In order to win a game you must successfully fulfill the mission objective for a level. Advance rules and challenge cards allow you to tailor the difficulty of each level, and all three levels can be combined into a single campaign - the true test of a Space Marine hero!

A family game about cooking, with "anisauces" as main characters (cats and mices fussioned with sauceboat) and funny faced ingredients to create dishes using menu sheets as combination guides.
It's a card game with a board for score-keeping and some other elemments.
Every card has fixed points, so every success combination gives points to the player who play the dish. The first character to reach the 50 points goal point will became the winner.

item.description:
Vanquisher is a game of abstract territorial control, engine building, and city building. Players take on the role of kings competing to fill newly discovered land with their own buildings, while trying to block others from doing the same. Each player will use resources, bribe officials, and send armies in order to create the dominant kingdom and claim the land as their own.

In Vanquisher, players will take turns performing actions and constructing buildings in a limited map area. The area consists of a grid, where players will place their newly constructed buildings. But careful planning is essential, since buildings can only be constructed without them touching, a specification that can be used to a player’s advantage. Each constructed building will also give a special benefit to the player which they can use throughout the game to assist them in collecting resources, using army tokens to block other players, and allow them to use additional actions during their turns. A player can additionally use actions to bribe officials, which take form of cards that will assist them in creating a more efficient engine to claim the most land.

The game ends after 12 rounds, and players get points from territorial control, and bonus points for achievements, money, and certain buildings.

This game was made available as a free Print and Play by Ngb Designs.

From the Game:
In a realm much like our own, Kings search for undiscovered territory to expand their kingdom. News has spread of new land found far across the mountains, and Kings now rush to claim it as their own and vanquish others along the way.
Vanquisher is a strategic kingdom building game. Players take turns constructing buildings, growing their armies, and bribing officials in order to spread their influence on the unclaimed territory. It is up to the players to manage their resources to help grow their kingdom, and stop others from growing theirs.

PORN: The Game! is an homage to the history and beauty of vintage smut; an era, before the internet, where seedy shops and dirty theaters were where the pervs got their kicks; VHS tapes, Glory holes, Donkey Shows and Orgies; when bushes were as beautiful as mustaches sexy.

The game contains Explicit - Original Art, in Vintage Grindhouse style, creating a casual and highly entertaining deck, which seems to have come directly from the Sexploitation-era of the 1970’s & 80’s.

LIKE OPERATING A PEEPSHOW BOOTH, THE RULES ARE EASY:

Players drink and swindle one another as they race to be the first to unload their cards.
Everyone starts with four, while the rest are set aside to draw from.

Take turns playing a card and follow the rules accordingly.
The first to get rid of all their cards wins.

Simple stuff (like putting on a condom*).

 Metaphorically speaking




Sometimes several players win and, often, many players lose;
but in the end, EVERYONE gets screwed."

—description from the publisher
